Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the resolution of the John Doe criminal investigation by stating that it has been completely resolved and two judges have said it is "over." This may be an exaggeration as investigations can often have ongoing aspects or unresolved issues.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the statement that the investigation has been resolved and two judges have declared it over. It is unclear what specific judges or rulings are being referred to.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the secret John Doe investigation of the campaign has been resolved based on the statement made by Gov. Scott Walker. However, it does not provide any additional information or evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or viewpoints regarding the status of the investigation. It presents only one perspective, which may indicate a bias towards a particular narrative.
